Description: White glazed composition shabti with painted purple painted detail: a striated lappet-wig, a collar, crossed hands in relief holding two hoes, the front and sides of the legs are inscribed with three rows of purple painted nonsensical Hieroglyphs, at the back is a seed-basket, a fake(?).
Curator's comments: Although the inscription consists of assorted repeated hieroglyphs giving no connected sense, the acquisition date (1840) makes it unlikely that this could be a fake.
